data.title: Awesome Rehab.
data.text: City did a great job recently with the new Dilworth Plaza,there is always something to do as well as just chilling and taking in the view.

data.title: Very Attractive
data.text: I love the water park portion of this and the added attraction of the skating rink makes it perfect for all types of fun in the summer and winter seasons great work to whomever designed this city attraction!

data.title: A must see when in Philadelphia
data.text: Dilworth park is located in the heart of center city (Philadelphia- city hall) so you cant miss it. It's a beautiful building with some really amazing architect which the city has done a good job of preserving. You can walk around it and walk through the middle.  The city has really done a fantstic job and making this a place to come do stuff.  In the summer you can skate board or sit back, relax, and people watch- on really hot days their is also a fountain to run through if you want to cool down. .  Their is a cafe where you can get a bite to eat and drink, alcohol as well.  In the winter they put up a skating rink which is really cool.  Philadelphia also host events in the space throughout the year- my husband and I recently attended Philadelphia Magazine best of style event where they put up tents and you can sample the best of vendors throughout philly- It is a ticketed event and its been in this space the last 2 years so who knows maybe it will be back there again next year- Either way no matter what time of year be sure to check it out.

data.title: You Start by Just Sticking Your Feet in
data.text:
It's something that would be a movie directors dream because this backdrop is probably the coolest one to have. 

So you walk through city hall building like you would Cinderella castle in Dina are you world but on the other side is this floor fountains about a football field long. The fountains are shooting up in the air about 1" like little springs, a hundred of them if not more. 

There is a path curved down the middle so you take your shoes off and walk down the middle. But then, the springs start to play this little game where they will shoot up real high and stop all at once. Repeating over and over and kids sunning through it fully clothed. 

It was not joking before this addictive yet simple concept hAs you running though it like some romantic comedy scene. 

A great unexpected time fun for all ages, and bring a towel. ;)

data.title: Great use of down town piece of land .
data.text: While serving 3 weeks on jury duty I would often eat my breakfast or lunch there . Located in the very center of downtown Philly . Heard is was even better at night .Has a double staircase leading down to the under ground concourse .where they have at least 20 places to either buy food or eat , [2 Donkin Donuts ,Pretzel factory, at least 4 pizza places and  a lot of stores .

data.title: New & Improved City Hall Sites
data.text:
The change in Philly is amazing. What used to be a bit of a sketchy area of Center City, Dilworth Park is now a highlight. The fountains are a great place to enjoy, but also the locals enjoy the area for a safe playing area for children. There are also options for eating and it's just very pleasant and relaxing. 

Additionally in the summer, Dilworth Park offers some fun happy hours, and yappy hours (for the pups), making this a popular venue for hanging out in the summer nights.

data.title: Fun for All!
data.text: I love the upgrades, the water feature is great for summertime fun. I bring my kiddos here to cool off. Conveniently, it's a straight ride for me... the Market-Frankford leaves you right there. Walk up the steps and run straight to the water!

data.title: Newly renovated
data.text: The city has renovated Dilworth Plaza and has transformed it into a wonderful place to visit. During the winter months, there is an ice skating rink, local performers, food, and booths to buy interesting things from local artists and crafters. During the summer, there is an area that the kids can run thru water which they love.

data.title: Something Is Always Happening
data.text: I work on the first building just right in front of the old city. I can see everyday that there is some festivities happening everyday and kids running in and out of the water fountains. It has a nice cafe shop, food trucks and many seating area. It is clean here has there are many park and grounds keep all picking up trash and officer around.

data.title: Delightful
data.text: A great place to go in the heat of the city. Kids and adults will enjoy running through the water. There are benches for sitting or changing a baby. Be careful though the benches could be hot.

data.title: Philadelphian
data.text: Great place to visit if you are from Philly or just visiting.  Always something to experience.  Do not miss!

data.title: Philly's Beautiful Park at City Hall
data.text: Dilworth was long needed in this city. They recently moved the love statue here while Love park is renovated. It is beautiful and clean and no homeless people. Additionally the park staff are wonderful, they make sure that no one tries to rip off tourists and charge for taking photos at the Love statue. I am so happy Philly has created the modern place for all of us to enjoy for free!

data.title: new and improved
data.text: After all the work on this park it is finally done but is nice, good job, easy access to the market street line, they have room to have different functions like xmas time village during the winter and little outdoor activities in the summer. it also is a great spot to take pictures of city hall and other sites in the area.

data.title: Stunning Park
data.text: Great park and temporary home for the Love Statue.  It has a gorgeous promenade area that also has a water installation.

data.title: City Hall?
data.text: Believe it or not, this is City Hall... a magnificent structure unto itself in the last few years is now a destination for locals and tourists.  Ice skating rink in the winter...now across the street a whole new park is being built as another destination and not just a pop-up Christmas time attraction.

data.title: It's a parking lot with a water feature
data.text: With city employees parking on the city hall apron and this huge expanse of nothing except some water jets, a few wobbly tables and subway entrances that looked like they were designed in the 1960s as imaginary futuristic design, there's zero reason to dodge the manic drivers trying to get back to the suburbs only to find you're stuck there.

data.title: While I like what they've done with it, it's still just City Hall to me. Probably because I was born and raised here.
data.text: The tourist seem to LOVE IT!!!! Outdoor movies in the summer, ice skating in the winter that converts into a water sprinkler for the kids in the spring/summer months. Always something entertaining going on for those visiting Philadelphia.

data.title: Summer time Happy Hour with Sounds
data.text: After hour Happy Hour, Good Music, Dancing, and Drinks with meeting new people in the City. Cant wait for this year

data.title: Phillys new meeting place
data.text: You never know what you'll see at Dilworth Plaza.  In the winter there is an ice skating rink, and summer underground sprinklers. Phillys Love statue is now situated in Dilworth Plaza,while Love Park is being renovated. It is a beautiful place to just sit, people watch, or have lunch. Dilworth Plaza is in front of Philadelphias City Hall. City Hall is a gorgeous building, not sure how many statues are on the building, could be hundreds. It's always something new being demonstrated at Dilworth Plaza.

data.title: Freshly done and well worth the visit!
data.text: The fresh new public space in Philadelphia. Seems to be where things are happening. Ice skating in the winter, cool interactive fountains in warm months where you can walk a serpentine path to stay dry, or kids can splash and cool off. Light food, and special events. Last summer Stevie Wonder gave a  free hour-long concert here!
